data.title: "Passport To Danger" (Hal Roach Studios)(1954
data.text:
ctva

CTVA US Adventure - "Passport To Danger" (Hal Roach Studios)(1954-55) starring Cesar Romero

CTVA

The Classic TV Archive - US Adventure series

Passport to Danger (1954-55)

Episode Guide compiled by The Classic TV Archive

with contributions by: Jim Brent, Rina Fox, Alan Keeling

references:

Library of Congress (telnet://locis.loc.gov)

Internet Movie Database (https://us.imdb.com)

British Film Institute (#13 #22 #24 #37)

Rabco Production

Filmed through the facilities of Hal Roach Studios, Hollywood, California

for

First-Run Syndication

Produced by Hal Roach Jr.

Associate Producer Jerry Stagg

Series Created by Robert C. Dennis

US Adventure series 1954-55 39 episodes x 30 min

starring

Cesar Romero

as Steve McQuinn

Premise:

Adventures of a Diplomatic Courier.

"One of the vital functions of the United States Government is to establish and maintain diplomatic relations with other countries.

In every friendly and civilized nation in the world there is an American Embassy or Legation. Whether it is Paris or Cairo, Shanghai

or any other remote outpost, the most reliable and confidential means of communication is the Courier service.

Armed only with his Passport, the Courier, like a global postman delivers the Top Secret dispatches of our Government."

############ Passport to Danger ##############

############## season 1954-55 ###############

##############################################

Episodes listed in Alphabetical Order (except Pilot)

1.1 [--] Passport to Danger: BUDAPEST, HUNGARY (Pilot episode) [verified on film]

Prod. no. 9549.

06Oct55 New Haven, CT

Story & Screenplay by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Roy Kellino

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Steven Geray .......... Virgil

Douglass Dumbrille .... Bernard

John Mylong ........... Saratoff

Ludwig Stossel ........ Petrof

Albert Szabo .......... Bartok

Nadja Posey ........... Gisela No. 1

Teresa Tudor .......... Gisela No. 2

Synopsis:

Steve McQuinn becomes the cellmate of a Hungarian priest, and the decoy of the secret police. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A Hungarian priest jailed for anti-Communist activities gets a helping hand from McQuinn.

1.2 [--] Passport to Danger: ANTIGUA

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

******************** no details **********************

[--] Passport to Danger: Unknown (possibly "Antigua")

Guest cast:

Rita Lynn

Robert Tafur

Synopsis:

McQuinn uncovers the plot of a speculator who wants to keep coffee prices high. [RF]

1.3 [--] Passport to Danger: ATHENS, GREECE [verified on film]

19Apr56 Chicago, IL

Story & Screenplay by Robet C. Dennis

Directed by Sobey Martin

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Carolyn Jones .......... Celia

Mark Dana .............. Terrance

Steven Geray ........... Nikos

Raymond Greenleaf ...... Mordicai

Pat Aherne ............. Major Seager

Peter Mamakos .......... Alianos

Maria Costi ............ Iolanthe

Bert Le Baron .......... Korba

Jean Ransome ........... Maid

Josephine Parra ........ Nurse

Synopsis:

When Steve meets a beautiful lady in an Athens café, he uncovers an international drug smuggling racket. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A beautiful woman involves McQuinn with international dope smugglers.

1.4 [--] Passport to Danger: BAJA, CALIFORNIA [verified on film]

03May56 Chicago, IL

Written by ?

Directed by ?

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Dan Seymour .......... Uncle Oscar Padilla

Jan Merlin ........... Matt Lynch

June Vincent ......... Cora

William Ching ........ Lt. Al Jacoby

Albert Carrier ....... Alvaro

Tony Roux ............ Octavio

Eva Ralf ............. Dr. Inna Taplov

Coulter Irwin ........ Control Tower Navy Man

Synopsis 1:

Steve's plane crash lands in Mexico during a hurricane, and the first person to reach the wreckage is a desperate criminal. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Survivors of a plane crash are menaced by a desperate criminal. [RF]

1.5 [--] Passport to Danger: BATAVIA

02Jan58 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Dan Seymour

Synopsis 1:

McQuinn helps a girl find her missing boy friend in this far-off place. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A Batavian plantation owner holds the key to a man's disappearance. [RF]

1.6 [--] Passport to Danger: BELGRADE

28Jul56 Wichita, KS

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Dan Seymour

Maria Palmer

Synopsis 1:

A dying man on an express train to Belgrade tells Steve McQuinn about an assassination plot. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn discovers an assassination plot on the Simplon Express to Belgrade. [RF]

1.7 [--] Passport to Danger: BRISBANE

12Jun58 Johnson City, TN

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Peter Adams

Shawn Smith

Lumsden Hare

Synopsis 1:

Diplomatic courier Steve McQuinn tries to find the beautiful blonde who left an envelope of top secret documents in a local bar. He

can't seem to locate her but he has no trouble finding-murder. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn's search for a mysterious girl involves top-secret documents and murder. [RF]

1.8 [--] Passport to Danger: CALCUTTA

29Jun56 Lawton, OK

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Dorothy Patrick

Robert Cabel

Naji

Harvey Stephens

Synopsis:

Steve tries vainly to recover a plague-ridden hawk stolen from him upon his arrival in Calcutta. The hawk was destined for a doctor. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A plague-ridden hawk is stolen from McQuinn in Calcutta. [RF]

1.9 [--] Passport to Danger: CASABLANCA, MOROCCO [verified on film]

copyright 1954 / 29Jun55 Dayton, OH

Story & Screenplay by Mindret Lord

Directed by Sobey Martin

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Hillary Brooke ......... Mae Rand

Rudolph Anders ......... Bender

Leonard George ......... Mohmoud

William Forrest ........ Evans

Charles Horvath ........ Hejaz

Eugene Mazzola ......... Ali El Nouri

Synopsis 1:

Entering a house in Casablanca's native quarter on an errand of mercy, Steve and his beautiful companion Mae Rand walk

right into headquarters for an uprising. A commanding German has them imprisoned for what they have seen. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Revolutionaries match wits with McQuinn as he tries to halt an uprising in Casablanca. [RF]

1.10 [--] Passport to Danger: DAMASCUS

04Jun56 New Haven, CT

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Paula Vernay

Synopsis 1:

Steve is assigned to protect an Arabian sultan enroute to Damascus.[JB]

Synopsis 2:

An Arabian sultan, en route to an important meeting, must be protected from assassins. [RF]

1.11 [--] Passport to Danger: DUBLIN

12Aug56 Dayton, OH

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Nancy Lee

Michael Emmet

James Fairfax

Michael Pate

Synopsis 1:

A small black bag, placed in his luggage when he disembarked at Dublin, involves Steve in the doings of some Irish patriots. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A small black satchel involves McQuinn with Irish patriots. [RF]

1.12 [--] Passport to Danger: EDINBURGH

19Dec56 Boston, MA

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Reginald Denny

Lili Fontaine

Synopsis 1:

Steve is suspected in a plot to unearth an ancient treasure. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Buried treasure and McQuinn's old identity card are linked to an Edinburgh murder. [RF]

1.13 [--] Passport to Danger: GENEVA, SWITZERLAND [BFI] [verified on film]

aka "Wrong Grandson"

copyright 1955 / US synd: 12Mar56

Story & Screenplay by Gene Wang

Directed by Sobey Martin

director of photography, Lucien Andriot, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Karen Booth ......... Jenny

Oscar Beregi ........ Dr Bartok

Sasha Harden ........ Alex Teleki

Peter Coe ........... Klafka

Gene Roth ........... Karolyi

Irvin Ashkenazy ..... Dembinski

Fritz Ford .......... Damjanick

Synopsis:

A Hungarian patriot's grandson seeks political asylum in Geneva with McQuinn. [RF]

1.14 [--] Passport to Danger: HAVANA

15Feb56 Sacramento, CA

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Lina Romay

Stuart Randall

Hy Anzel

Harris Brown

Synopsis:

Steve McQuinn is disturbed to discover that a friend is piloting passengers into the country illegally. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn tries to find out why an honest flier is bringing people into Havana illegally. [RF]

1.15 [--] Passport to Danger: HELSINKI

14Jul56 Boston, MA

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Gladys Holland

John Miljan

Synopsis 1:

Steve gets involved in a political feud, further complicated by a

Romeo-and-Juliet situation when he plays cupid in Helsinki for a couple he introduced. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn tries to reconcile two Helsinki lovers whose families differ politically. [RF]

1.16 [--] Passport to Danger: JOHANNESBURG

06Feb58 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

James Gleason

Noreen Nash

Synopsis 1:

McQuinn protects a prospector who has found a huge diamond. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A Johannesburg prospector's life is threatened after he discovers a huge diamond. [RF]

1.17 [--] Passport to Danger: LIMA

05Feb56 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Walter Sande

Elinor Donahue

Ted de Corsia

Synopsis:

Steve McQuinn doesn't suspect that his young lady traveling companion on a plane to Lima, Peru,

will play a vital part in his capture of a big-time American racketeer. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A big-time U.S. racketeer flees to Lima with McQuinn (Cesar Romero) hot on his trail. [RF]

1.18 [--] Passport to Danger: LONDON

09Jul56 Detroit, MI

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Virginia Christine

Victoria Ward

Carl Esmond

Scott Forbes

Synopsis:

A war widow insists to diplomatic courier Steve McQuinn that she has found the German nurse, who betrayed her husband.

The widow, now in the hospital, believes that the place is the center of a spy ring. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

London is the scene of an investigation involving a spy ring, a hospital and McQuinn. [RF]

1.19 [--] Passport to Danger: MACAO [verified on film]

copyright 1955 / 02-Jul-1956 Chicago, IL /04Jul56 NYC

Written by Donald S. Sanford

Directed by Sobey Martin

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Alan Hale Jr. ........ Danforth Brown

Irene Tedrow ......... Ruby Chen

Charles Lung ......... Ma Chang

Adeline de Walt Reynolds ....... Anna Semyonov

Ernest Sarracino ....... Capt. de Lacerda

Otto Reichow ......... Bowker

Beulah Kwoh .......... Ming Shu

William Tannen ....... U.S. Consul Barrett

Bruno Ve Sota ........ Hoi Shen

Synopsis 1:

After a mission to Hong Kong, Steve McQuinn stops at Macao to see an old friend.

Soon after their reunion, the friend is killed. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A diplomatic courier's friend is killed. [RF]

1.20 [--] Passport to Danger: MADRID

22Jun55 Dayton, OH

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Yvette Dugay

Abel France

Vincente Padula

Synopsis 1:

A beautiful Duchess captures Steve McQuinn's heart, and is then kidnapped by powerful enemies.

Steve is involved in a series of events through his efforts to save her life. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn becomes involved with a Spanish countess in Madrid. [RF]

1.21 [--] Passport to Danger: MARSEILLES

15Dec55 New Haven, CT

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

**** no guest cast details *****

Synopsis:

Steve masquerades as a murdered man in an effort to learn more about underground activities. [JB]

[--] Passport to Danger: Unknown (possibly "Marseilles")

Guest cast:

Susan Seaforth ......... Mme. Garreau

Synopsis:

Mme. Garreau has a lucrative trade getting persons without passports to South America. [RF]

1.22 [--] Passport to Danger: MEXICO CITY [BFI]

08Mar56 New Haven, CT

Written by Donald S. Sandford

Directed by Sobey Martin

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Edgar Barrier ......... Ruiz

Manual Rojas .......... Vincente

Robin Short

Donna Martell

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn tries to help a frightened youth who is to debut as a matador. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn befriends a frightened Mexican youth who is making his debut as a matador. [RF]

1.23 [--] Passport to Danger: MONTE CARLO, MONACO [verified on film]

copyright 1955 / 09Dec58 Chicago, IL

Story and Screenplay by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Sobey Martin

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Ann Robinson ........ Jorie Vinay

Leonid Kinskey ..... Solov

Richard Hale ........ M'sieu Vinay

Mel Welles .......... Regis

Roland Varno ........ Garside

Henry Corden ........ Feisel

Rolfe Sedan ......... Asssitant Manager of Casino

Jean Del Val ........ Croupier

Leo Mostovoy ........ Shopkeeper

Synopsis 1:

One of America's allies is trying to protect its oil interests. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A U.S. ally tries to protect oil interests by helping a deposed monarch regain his throne. [RF]

1.24 [--] Passport to Danger: NAPLES [BFI]

US synd: 7May56

Written by Frank L. Moss

Directed by Erle C. Kenton

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Paul Picerni ........ Eddie

Harry Lauter

Lester Matthews

Henry Corden

Anthony Caruso

Toni Gearry

Synopsis:

International smugglers complicate McQuinn's attempt to renew an old friendship. [RF]

1.25 [--] Passport to Danger: NEW YORK

01Jan58 Topeka, KS

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Mary Beth Hughes

Jean Willis

Synopsis 1:

McQuinn masquerades as a government agent in order to find out about espionage activities. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn investigates a dancing school said to be a front for an espionage ring. [RF]

1.26 [--] Passport to Danger: PARIS

22Feb55 Los Angeles, CA

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Ina Anders

William Ching

Lita Milan

Mark Dana

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn, in Paris, tries to save his best friend from scandal and ruin. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn tries to aid a friend accused of selling confidential information to France. [RF]

1.27 [--] Passport to Danger: PRAGUE, CZECHOSLOVAKIA [verified on film]

04Jul57 Kansas City, MO

Story and Screenplay by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Sobey Martin

Director of Photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Ted de Corsia ......... Jan Spolny

Peter Brocco .......... Dolezal

Pamela Duncan ......... Alenka Melnik

Gerry Gayler .......... Mia Klouda

John Bleifer .......... Gregus

Peter Coe ............. Egon

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn helps a Czech skating star escape from Prague to be reunited with her husband. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A Czech skating star wants to escape from Prague and join her husband in London. [RF]

1.28 [--] Passport to Danger: RANGOON

08Dec55 New Haven, CT

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Phillip Ahn

Soo Yong

Keye Luke

Maria Pinki Tsien

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn tries to help an Indian holy man's village. Bandits have been victimizing the people. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Bandits have invaded the quiet village of an Indian holy man. [RF]

1.29 [--] Passport to Danger: RIO DE JANEIRO

29Dec55 New Haven, CT

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Fay Wall

Ernest Sarracino

Yvette Dugay

John Wengraf

Synopsis 1:

It's carnival time in Rio! But Steve McQuinn is busy trying to find

a young woman's missing husband and preventing a young girl's elopement. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn must stop an elopement and find a missing husband during carnival time in Rio. [RF]

1.30 [--] Passport to Danger: ROME, ITALY [verified on film]

(copyright 1955) 13-Feb-1956 Sacramento, CA

Story & Screenplay by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Erle C. Kenton

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Donna Martell ......... Lilliana

Carl Milletaire ....... Florio

David Kasday .......... Nino

Donald Curtis ......... Fitzpatrick

Ivan Triesault ........ Hoenschen

Frank Nechero ......... Carabinieri Police

Victor Romito ......... Carabinieri Officer

Synopsis 1:

Diplomatic courier Steve McQuinn helps out a Roman beauty who has gotten herself mixed up with a gang of counterfeiters. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A beautiful girl gets mixed up with counterfeiters in Rome. [RF]

1.31 [--] Passport to Danger: SAIGON

19Feb56 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Warren Lee

Richard Leo

Angela Greene

Synopsis:

After his plane is downed, Steve McQuinn hitchhikes on a boat to Saigon

During a flight aboard ship, Communist agents steal his dispatch case. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Communist agents steal McQuinn's dispatch case on a boat to Saigon. [RF]

1.32 [--] Passport to Danger: SOFIA, BULGARIA [verified on film]

07Mar56 Providence, RI

Story & Screenplay by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Frederick Stephani

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Murvyn Vye ............ Knoum

Stephen Bekassy ....... Dr. Konstantin

Alana Monet ........... Adriane Passovi

Nestor Paiva .......... Hristov

Bill Henry ............ Ross

Rolfe Sedan ........... Porter

Mary Young ............ Flower Woman

Gil Warren ............ Passport Control

Peter Camlin .......... Clark

Synopsis 1:

Steve tries to buy his freedom from the Bulgarian secret police. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Bulgaria's secret police arrest McQuinn for theft. [RF]

1.33 [--] Passport to Danger: TANGIER, NORTH MOROCCO [verified on film]

Screenplay by Donald S. Sanford

Based on a Story by Robert C. Dennis

Directed by Erle C. Kenton

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Carol Thurston ........ Marija

Celia Lovsky .......... Countess Kovalewska

Jan Merlin ............ Radovan

Sig Arno .............. Novak

Frank Wilcox .......... Anderson

Gabor Curtiz .......... Grigori

William Yetter ........ Sarge Captain

Synopsis:

McQuinn, in Tangier, helps a refugee who's wanted by Bulgaria's secret police. [RF]

1.34 [--] Passport to Danger: TEHERAN

20Jul55 Dayton, OH

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Nestor Paiva

Carl Esmond

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn tastes the pleasures and dangers of inherited fortune-if only temporarily. Steve arrives in Teheran on leave

from his courier duties to meet an old friend-only to be greeted by a flying bullet and news of his friend's death. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn attempts to solve a successful oil prospector's murder in Teheran. [RF]

1.35 [--] Passport to Danger: TEL AVIVI

11Sep58 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast:

Peter Votrian

Karen Verne

Peter Brocco

Sig Arno

Synopsis 1:

A DP boy arrives in Israel by plane and disappears before his mother reaches the airport to meet him. She turns to Steve McQuinn for help. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A refugee mother searches Tel Aviv for her kidnapped son. [RF]

1.36 [--] Passport to Danger: TRIESTE

23May55 Syracuse, NY

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Phillip Tonge

Jorja Curtwright

Paula Corday

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn finds a coded Latin book is the key to an enemy spy ring. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

Diplomatic courier McQuinn is stuck with a mysterious book and enemy agents want it. [RF]

1.37 [--] Passport to Danger: ANKARA, TURKEY [verified on film][BFI]

US synd: 16Feb56 / 22-Mar-1956 Chicago, IL

Screenplay by Donald S. Sanford

Directed by Sobey Martin

director of photography, Jack MacKenzie, A.S.C.

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest Cast;

Gladys Holland ......... Lucia Valencic

John E. Wengraf ........ Colonel Bucar

Christopher Cook ....... Peter Djuro

Nick Dennis ............ Farrag

Mel Welles ............. Komiser Ardates

Michael Mark ........... Mustapha Kemel

Peter Michael .......... Turk Policeman

Sherry Alberoni ?

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn befriends the children of an escaped Rumanian industrialist. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn protects a Rumanian industrialist and his children from enemy agents. [RF]

1.38 [-] Passport to Danger: VIENNA

19Aug56 Dayton, OH

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Lisa Gaye

Gregory Gay

John Warburton

John Hamilton

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn gets more than he expected when he promises an American

senator that he will look up the man's daughter in a Vienna ballet school. [JB]

Synopsis 2:

A U.S. senator's daughter, studying ballet in Vienna, gets mixed up in international intrigue. [RF]

1.39 [--] Passport to Danger: ZAMBOANGA

10Jun56 Kansas City, MO

Starring: Cesar Romero (as Steve McQuinn)

Guest cast:

Gale Robbins

James Burke

Alexander Campbell

Michael Pate

James Seay

Linda Goodridge

Synopsis 1:

Steve McQuinn is asked by the American government to investigate an

American chorus girl who's supposed to marry the Prince of Borneo.[JB]

Synopsis 2:

McQuinn investigates an American chorus girl who's supposed to marry the prince of Borneo. [RF]

############ Passport to Danger ##############

################# the end ##################

##############################################
